USGS, Snake River Field Station 20031106 cell_towers_sgca vector digital data http://srfs.wr.usgs.gov/Fresc_ScienceData/communication_towers_sgca.zip https://www.sciencebase.gov/catalog/item/54247bbfe4b037b608f9ed99 Hard copy of the distirbution of communication towers can be found in Figure 7.21, Chapter 7, p. 90, in Connelly, J. W., S. T. Knick, M. A. Schroeder, and S. J. Stiver. 2004. Conservation assessment of Greater Sage-grouse and sagebrush habitats. Western Association of Fish and Wildlife Agencies. Unpublished Report. Cheyenne, Wyoming. http://sagemap.wr.usgs.gov/ cell_towers_sgca
Cellular phone microwave towers registered with the U.S. Federal Communications Commission. Not all antennas are required to be registered with the FCC, therefore, this data set does not necessarily depict ALL cellular phone communication towers actually present on the landscape. The source data are updated weekly by the FCC as new permits are issued. However, this particular data set is designed for a specific analysis, and is planned to remain static as of the publication date (11/06/2003). This spatial data set was initially developed for use on the Rangewide Conservation Assessment for Sage Grouse, but the data set has general use applications. There are known (and obvious) spatial errors. Some towers are mislocated in the source data. en

The location of several features have incorrect coordinates. The true accuracy of the remaining features is unknown and untested.
Dependent upon the source data. Because not all communication antennas are required to be registered with the FCC, this data set does not necessarily depict ALL communication features on the landscape. Furthermore, the FCC updates this source database on a weekly basis but this shapefile was created for a short-term analysis and contains only data available on 11/6/2003.
unknown, see source data
Federal Communication Commission 20031106 Cellular Telephone Towers tabular digital data ftp://ftp.fcc.gov/pub/Bureaus/Wireless/Databases/uls/complete/l_cell.zip
online
20031106
publication date
cell_towers location and attributes of the communication antenna towers
We imported the 'LO.dat' table into MS Access, then extracted pertinent data into a new table using the 'make-table' query function. We then converted the 'degree', 'minute' and 'second' fields for both latitude and longitude into 2 fields (one for latitude, one for longitude) containing decimal degrees using the formula: degrees+(minutes/60)+(seacond/3600). We exported this output table into delimited text (*.txt) format. ftp://ftp.fcc.gov/pub/Bureaus/Wireless/Databases/uls/complete/l_cell.zip 20031106 1300 cell_towers.txt

Added text file 'cell_towers.txt' as a table into ArcMap 8.3 using Tools --> addXY... and then converted the tabular data to a shapefile using the 'Data --> Export data...' function. cell_towers.dbf 20031106 cell_towers.shp

UPOLE Utility pole/tower used to provide service (electric, telephone, etc) FCC

Downloadable Data We make every effort to provide and maintain accurate, complete, usable, and timely information on our web sites. However, some USGS data and information accessed through these pages may, of necessity, be preliminary in nature and presented prior to final review and approval by the Director of the USGS. These data and information are provided with the understanding that they are not guaranteed to be correct or complete. Users are cautioned to consider carefully the provisional nature of these data and information before using them for decisions that concern personal or public safety or the conduct of business that involves substantial monetary or operational consequences. Conclusions drawn from, or actions undertaken on the basis of, such data and information are the sole responsibility of the user.

Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U.S. Geological Survey, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the accuracy or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from a U.S. Geological Survey server, and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. It is also strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data. The U.S. Geological Survey shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein.
